sentences.english: One security guard used it as a shield against the torrent of people that streamed into the store.
sentences.chinese: 有个保安把该门板用作盾牌，抵挡涌入商场的人潮。

sentences.english: Shooting a movie in Hsimenting attracts a wave of on- lookers in no time.
sentences.chinese: 在西门町拍电影，马上引来观看的人潮。

sentences.english: As night falls, the hall will be swamped by people.
sentences.chinese: 一入夜，这个大厅就会人潮如涌。
人潮拥挤再也不会不期而遇。

sentences.english: Crowds of people flow to Lieshi Park.
sentences.chinese: 烈士公园里到处是传流不息的人潮。

sentences.english: Beware of pickpockets in crowded department stores.
sentences.chinese: 在人潮拥挤的百货公司里，要当心扒手。

sentences.english: A police spokesman said the revelers was finally broken up at 1.55 am Saturday morning.
sentences.chinese: 警方发言人说，人潮在周六凌晨1点55分终于散去。

sentences.english: It will become a new landmark in Tamsui after attracting the large crowds.
sentences.chinese: 届时一定可以吸引大量人潮，成为淡水地区新地标。

sentences.english: Yet the crowds in union square last december were as bad as ever.
sentences.chinese: 然而去年的联合广场依旧是人潮如涌。

sentences.english: Scale early to avoid tour busloads.
sentences.chinese: 提前来参观避开人潮吧。

sentences.english: In the next film there are lots of huge crowds scenes.
sentences.chinese: 下一部电影中将会出现大量的人潮拥挤的镜头。

sentences.english: We went into the crowded shop to fit on new boots and skis.
sentences.chinese: 我们到挤满人潮的店里试穿滑雪靴。

sentences.english: I asked like shouting at her out of a noisy sea of people.
sentences.chinese: 我在拥挤的人潮中，扯着嗓子问阿雅。

sentences.english: Municipal plaza, crowded with waiting for the madness of the crowd counting down the seconds.
sentences.chinese: 市政广场前，挤满了等待倒数读秒的疯狂人潮。

sentences.english: In Shanghai there are always tremendous crowds commuting to work and going to major events.
sentences.chinese: 在上海总是有大量的人潮通勤上班，以及参加大活动。

sentences.english: We walke right past all those people in line and we didn't even have to pay cover charge.
sentences.chinese: 我们不用管排队人潮，连小费都不用付就进去了。

definition: stream of people/abortion/abbr. for 人工流產|人工流产[ren2 gong1 liu2 chan3]
lit. rubbing shoulders and following in each other's footsteps/a thronging crowd
the stream flows without stopping (idiom); unending flow
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
